      • generateMacKeyFromPasswordGetSalt

        public CryptoIOHelper.SaltAndKey generateMacKeyFromPasswordGetSalt(char[] password,
                                                                   int keyLength)
                                                            throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Generates a MAC-Key from the given password with the given kelength. If the keylength is neither 128 nor 256 Bit, it will be set to 256 Bit.
        Parameters:
        password - the password
        keyLength - the desired keylength
        Returns:
        the SaltAndKey object
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

      • generateMacKeyFromPasswordSetSalt

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateMacKeyFromPasswordSetSalt(char[] password,
                                                                byte[] salt,
                                                                int keyLength)
                                                         throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Returns the Secret-MAC key generated with the specified salt value and the password.
        Parameters:
        password - The password used to derive the key.
        salt - The salt used to derive the key.
        keyLength - The key length.
        Returns:
        The secret MAC-Key.
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

        Parameters:
        mode - The mode for storage, choose SecureAndroid.SHARED_PREFERENCES or SecureAndroid.FILE.

        public boolean checkIntegrity(byte[] cipherText,
                              byte[] mac,
                              javax.crypto.SecretKey macKey)
                       throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Method the check the integrity of the given ciphertext against the given MAC with the given Secretkey
        Parameters:
        cipherText - the ciphertext to be checked
        mac - the Message Authentication code against which to check
        macKey - the secretkey
        Returns:
        true if check was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

                                   java.lang.String filename)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Saves MAC-Key to specified file, encoded in Base64. The file is only accessible by your app.
        Parameters:
        secretKey - the secret MAC-key
        filename - the file in which the key should be stored
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveMACKeyToSharedPrefBase64

        public void saveMACKeyToSharedPrefBase64(java.lang.String spAlias,
                                         java.lang.String keyAlias,
                                         javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
        Saves MAC-Key to specified SharePrefs, encoded in Base64. The file is only accessible by your app.
        Parameters:
        spAlias - the alias for the SharedPref
        keyAlias - the alias under which the key is stored in SharePref
        secretKey - the MAC-Key to be saved
